benchmark_details.name: GAME BENCH
benchmark_details.overview: GAME BENCH is a cross-domain benchmark for evaluating strategic reasoning abilities of LLM agents across various games, focusing on the strengths of reasoning skills identified in strategy games.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To measure the strategic reasoning abilities of LLM agents in diverse game environments.

data.source: Games played between LLM agents and human agents as described in the benchmark.
data.annotation: Game interactions and match results annotated by agent performances.

metrics: Ratings based on the exponential Bradley-Terry model
methodology.calculation: Weights among matches are calculated inversely to the number of matches per game, applying a bootstrapped sampling method for pairwise comparisons.
methodology.interpretation: Higher ratings indicate better strategic reasoning ability.
methodology.baseline_results: Human performance serves as the upper baseline, with models compared against each other and random action baseline.

targeted_risks.harm: Potential for advances in strategic reasoning capability leading to misuse or harmful AI applications.
